The Director of e-commerce is a cross-functional position that is responsible for leading, executing, and optimizing the company’s e-commerce strategy across its Global online sales channels and platforms for its business lines. The position has strong interfaces with Sales, Marketing, website & webstore, and Finance.
This person is responsible for various aspects of online operations, business planning, and marketing strategies. Minute Media is a global sports & entertainment media and technology company, having all its technological needs developed in-house, end to end, in a rapid big-data environment. Minute Media’s platform serves as the company’s foundation, powering its content as well as enabling the evolution of other market-leading digital media brands. To date, Minute Media’s owned and operated destinations include The Players’ Tribune, 90min, DBLTAP, Mental Floss, The Big Lead, and FanSided. For more information, visit www.MinuteMedia.com.
﻿Position Summary
﻿
Minute Media is looking for a Business Operations Director who will be responsible for performing both qualitative and quantitative analyses while using the findings to create decision-support mechanisms that will allow to optimize and enhance the business, to ensure reaching its KPIs and to answer important strategic questions. This position will be reporting directly to the VP Finance & Business Operations of the company with high visibility to C-level executives and company’s management.
﻿Responsibilities
Regularly partner business units’ management to track performance and provide information and ongoing business analysis to help guide day to day and strategic decision making.
Drive periodic review and analysis on unusual trends in key business metrics (KPIs) using business intelligence data.
Identify potential risks to business performance and recommend optional operational pathways.
Partner with operational and commercial teams to develop end to end procedures to support the business flow and the achievement of Company’s goals.
Make recommendations for change and manage the implementation.
Determine the operational implications of business decisions and projects and act accordingly to support and enable fluent business operations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities, generate ideas, and develop business cases for profitable growth.
Lead and implement strategic global initiatives for improvements and efficiencies to achieve business goals and operational excellence.

10+ years of relevant professional experience in the labour market
4+ years of experience in Business Operations / Ad Operations / Media Operations or a top-tier consulting firm
Can-do approach and ability to swiftly move from strategy planning to execution, and reiterate based on performance
Outstanding analytical skills, detail-oriented, proactive and self-motivated
Limitless curiosity about business models and understanding of how companies operate
A great communicator that can collaborate successfully with different teams within the business
Bachelor degree in Economics, Business Administration, Industrial Management Engineering, or any relevant degree from a leading institution is required

About Candex

Candex is a rapidly growing fintech player in the B2B payments market, which is one of the hottest markets in technology. Our solution is used by the Global 2000 to pay vendors in 30+ countries, fast & compliantly - clients include brands like 3M, Starbucks, Dell, Pfizer, Danone, L'Oréal, HSBC, Roche, Colgate, and many others. We have a world-class management team and $37m in funding from investors like Amex, JP Morgan, Altos, NFX, and Partech. As a member of our company, you will have a golden opportunity to reshape and impact how the biggest companies in the world manage a meaningful part of their business.

The company is growing rapidly, and we seek a Junior Operations Associate. This position will report to the VP of Operations. This is an opportunity to join the Candex Finance team and make a significant impact at a rapidly growing multinational fintech company.

The Role

This is a key role in delivering supreme support and service to our customers. You will be a valuable resource throughout the payment process and a crucial point of contact for our customers. If you have excellent interpersonal and communication expertise, strong writing and analytical skills and a desire to leverage your knowledge of fintech and payments; this opportunity is a perfect fit.

Administer pending payments and registrations.
Work with customers to correct payment details provided or to obtain any missing information.
Send out client invoices ensuring they are accurate and compliant.
Review customer invoices received ensuring their accuracy and timeliness.
Reconcile bank payments received against invoices.
Prepare bank transfers and ensure that customer bank details are verified.
Verify customer data by performing compliance checks.

Company Overview
KLA is a global leader in diversified electronics for the semiconductor manufacturing ecosystem. Virtually every electronic device in the world is produced using our technologies. No laptop, smartphone, wearable device, voice-controlled gadget, flexible screen, VR device or smart car would have made it into your hands without us. KLA invents systems and solutions for the manufacturing of wafers and reticles, integrated circuits, packaging, printed circuit boards and flat panel displays. The innovative ideas and devices that are advancing humanity all begin with inspiration, research and development. KLA focuses more than average on innovation and we invest 15% of sales back into R&D. Our expert teams of physicists, engineers, data scientists and problem-solvers work together with the world’s leading technology providers to accelerate the delivery of tomorrow’s electronic devices. Life here is exciting and our teams thrive on tackling really hard problems. There is never a dull moment with us.
Group/Division
KLA is well known for its high-performing business model which routinely produces significant profit margins and revenue. Key to supporting KLA business is the finance team that partners with corporate and global business organizations to provide expertise and guidance for developing and executing sound business models and practices. The Finance organization consists of operations and corporate finance teams. The operations finance team influences business decisions by gathering the best available operations information, distilling it and making recommendations to our management team on the best course of action. The corporate team provides a broad range of services, such as financial planning, corporate accounting, tax, industry analysis and benchmarking, internal audits, SEC reporting and merger and acquisition support.
Job Description
Responsibilities

We’re looking for a detail-oriented Financial Analyst to contribute to a great finance team and work cross-functionally within the company. The ideal candidate will work with multiple business functions and have the opportunity to affect the company’s overall long term financial performance.

The Division Revenue Financial Analyst will support the Division Controller and the VP/GM in driving revenue achievement. Responsibilities include:

Partner with sales, operations and other divisional functions to optimize revenue plan and execution.

Maintain accurate database for bookings, shipment, revenue history and forecast.

Perform scenario planning and support the annual strategic planning process.

Support period close processes, preparation of financial packages and reporting.

Provide analysis of business trends, such as customers, pricing, GM Analysis, etc...

Identify, support, and implement group process improvements.

Minimum Qualifications
Qualifications

Knowledge of basic revenue accounting and finance principles.
Excellent communication skill and ability to influence without direct authority.
Analytical mindset and ability to provide meaningful analyses that are concise and actionable.
Must be hard working, have a positive attitude and willingly contribute to a team.
Ability to meet deadlines, perform under time pressure, cope with the fast-pace environment, prioritize and multi-task.

About Us

Riskified empowers merchants and shoppers to realize the full potential of eCommerce by making it safe, accessible, and frictionless. Our global team helps the world's most-innovative eCommerce merchants eliminate risk and uncertainty from their business. Merchants integrate Riskified's machine learning platform to create trusted customer relationships, driving higher sales while reducing costs. Riskified has reviewed hundreds of millions of transactions and approved billions of dollars of revenue for global brands and fast-growing businesses across industries, including Wayfair, Wish, Peloton, Gucci, and many more. As of July 29th, 2021, Riskified has begun trading on NYSE under the ticker RSKD.
About the Role

Riskified's Finance team is hiring a Finance Operation Analyst to join our fast-growing company. In this role, You will be responsible for planning and analyzing the company's financials to ensure accurate recording and enable educated decision-making, and ongoing monitoring. Working with various teams on controls and accounting infrastructure to support the company's rapid growth and expansion. This is a rare and exciting opportunity to join a successful and growing company. We're looking for a sharp, technically oriented, and highly motivated person who wants to make a significant impact and join a dynamic, cross-functional team.

What You'll Be Doing
Generate target vs. actual analysis, investigate and explain key variances, trends, and drivers.
Provide support for the annual planning and financial forecasting processes.
Prepare presentations and analyses for senior management on a quarterly and monthly basis.
Participate in the development, implementation, and maintenance of accounting policies and internal controls to comply with legislation.
Support and manage the current process of the monthly billing cycle.
Ensure that detailed accounting documentation is compiled and maintained in support of relevant legal, regulatory, and audit requirements
Assist finance with ad-hoc reporting and analysis
Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or business (MBA and/or CPA is a big advantage)
Strong English skills - both oral and written - MUST
Working knowledge of Tableau (big advantage)
Strong analytical skills with high attention to detail
Strong presentation skills and the ability to put together sophisticated informative presentations with minimal direction and oversight
Prior experience in high-tech industry/start-up company (big advantage)
Advanced Excel / G-suite knowledge
Ability to meet deadlines and work under pressure
Strong collaborative team worker
